intro: Parrya menziesii var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth parrya, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically features smooth, hairless stems and leaves with a distinctive, often bluish-green hue. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. This variety is notable for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
